other_tests.findings: Sinus tachycardia at a rate of 134 beats per minute.

Restricted diffusion involving the cortex of the right temporal lobe, right occipital lobe, right superior and inferior parietal lobule, and right cingulate gyrus; fluid-attenuated inversion recovery images showed hyperintense signal and mild mass effect related to gyral swelling.
other_tests.changes_over_time: Repeat MRI performed 5 days after admission revealed improvement in the cortical swelling and FLAIR hyperintensities.

other_tests.findings: Continuous generalized background slowing in the delta and theta ranges, frequent intermittent focal delta-range slowing over the right hemisphere, and frequent sharp waves in the right frontotemporal region.
Clear, colorless cerebrospinal fluid with a glucose level of 92 mg/dL, total protein level of 33 mg/dL, 5 red cells, no white cells, and no organisms from Gram staining.
